revision.text:
{{hatnote|This article is about the OR7 navy rank ''Glavny starshina'' in Slavonic naval forces. For the equivalent in modern days Anglophone naval forces see [[Chief petty officer]], [[Colour sergeant]], and [[Gunnery sergeant]]. The equivalent in the German navy might be [[Hauptbootsmann]].}} {{infobox | above = [[File:Flag of Russia.svg|left|30px|border]]'''''Glavny starshina'''''
{{small|in the Russian navy}} | image = [[File: RAF N R7-GlStarsh 2010–.svg|85px]]   [[File:Red Fleet Insignia 1b.svg|85px]] | caption = (shoulder board) (sleeve insignia) | label1 = Rank insignia | data1 = [[Russian Navy]] | label2 = Introduction | data2 = 1940-43 | label3 = Rank group | data3 = Petty officer | label4 = Army / Air Force | data4 = [[Starshij sershant]] | label8 = [[Ranks and insignia of NATO|NATO
equivalent]] | data8 = OR-7The abbreviation "OR" stands for ''"Other Ranks / fr: sous-officiers et militaires du rang / ru:другие ранги, кроме офицероф"''}} '''''Glavny starshina''''' ({{lang-ru|Гла́вный старшина́; literal: chief/ senior petty officer}}) is in the [[Russian Navy|Navy]] of the [[Russian Federation]] the designation to the second highest rank in the '''''patty officer´s career group'''''. The rank is equivalent to ''Starshij sershant'' in Army and Air Force. According to [[Ranks and insignia of NATO|NATO-ranksystem]] the rank might be comparable to OR-7 in Anglophone armed forces. The rank was introduced to the Soviet Navy 1940 to 1943. {| class="wikipedia sortable" border="1" |- |+ '''Sequence of ranks in Russian Federation´s navy''' |- |width="30%" align="center" style="background:#cfcfcf;" | juinor rank:
[[Starshina 1st stage]] |width="35%" align="center" style="background:#bfbfbf;"|
[[File:Emblem of the Военно-Морской Флот Российской Федерации.svg|55px]]
''''' Glavny starshina ''''' |width="30%" align="center" style="background:#afafaf;" | senior rank:
[[ Glavny starshina of the ship]]
|}
In the navy of the Russian Federation there are four ranks in the patty officer´s career group, which means: *''Glavny starshina of the ship'' (OR-8) *'''''Glavny starshina''''' (OR-7) *''Starshina 1st stage'' (OR-6) *''Starshina 2nd stage'' (OR-4) ; Rank insignia '''''Glavny starshina''''' {| style="border:1px solid #8888aa; background-color:#f7f8ff; padding:5px; font-size:95%; margin: 12px 12px 12px 0px;" |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" align="center" ! | colspan=2| [[File:Naval Ensign of the Soviet Union 1935.svg|30px|border]] ! colspan=3| [[File:Naval Ensign of Russia.svg|30px|border]] |- align="center" | rowspan=2 |rank
insignia |   [[File:Red Fleet Insignia 2a.svg|60px]]   |   [[File:Red Fleet Insignia 1b.svg|60px]]   |     [[File:Rank insignia of главный старшина of the Soviet Navy.svg|60px]]     |[[File:RAF N R7CPO 1994-2010.svg|70px]] |[[File:RAF N R7CPO 1994-2010par.png|80px]] |- align="center" |sleeve 1940-1963
after 1963 to
Glavny starshina
of the ship |sleeve

from 1963 |shoulder
1955-1991 |colspan=2|shoulder
1991-2010 |} ==Rank designation in other countries== In the countries below, spelling is similar and classivication to a separate rank group is equivalent. *{{flagicon|Azerbaijan}} ⇒ {{lang-az|Baş starşinas}} *{{flagicon|Belarus}} ⇒ {{lang-be|Галоўны старшыня}} *{{flagicon|Lithuania}} ⇒ {{lang-lt|Vyriausiasis viršila}} *{{flagicon|Ukraine}} ⇒ {{lang-uk|Головни́й старшина́}} ==See also== *[[Ranks and rank insignia of the Red Army 1940–1943]] *[[Ranks and rank insignia of the Soviet Army 1943–1955]], [[Ranks and rank insignia of the Soviet Army 1955–1991|... 1955–1991]] *[[Ranks and rank insignia of the Russian Federation´s armed forces 1994–2010]] *[[Army ranks and insignia of the Russian Federation]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{italic title}} [[Category:Military ranks of Russia]] [[Category:Military ranks of the Soviet Union]]
